channel.title: Posts on Logseq Mastery blog
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Logseq Mastery blog

item.title: Logseq vs Obsidian - which PKM tool should you use?
item.description: In an era of information overwhelm, these two tools are leading the charge in helping users manage their personal knowledge.

item.title: Introducing purchasing power parity pricing to Logseq Mastery
item.description: Logseq Mastery now has purchasing power parity (PPP) pricing to make the course more accessible to a global audience.

item.title: Adding custom CSS to your Logseq database
item.description: Custom CSS is a great way to make your database more visually appealing. In this post I break down a simple way to implement CSS in your database.

item.title: How to use queries in Logseq
item.description: Queries give users a powerful mechanism to retrieve information from their databases, and will take your usage of Logseq up a notch. This post is a collection of excerpts from Logseq Mastery.

item.title: How I use Omnivore in my read-it-later workflow for articles
item.description: Discover Omnivore, the read-it-later app that organises online content and integrates seamlessly with Logseq.

item.title: Simplifying your workflow with Logseq templates
item.description: Some example Logseq templates and a text expander workflow (highly recommended!) for simplifying your template input

item.title: How to use namespaces in Logseq
item.description: Namespaces are a helpful feature in Logseq for those who like top-down approaches to information management. This post is a collection of excerpts from Logseq Mastery

item.title: Learning how to use Logseq
item.description: Learn how to use Logseq with these in-depth videos taking you through the mental models.

item.title: Logseq and the Rise of the Integrated Thinking Environment
item.description: Every knowledge worker should have an Integrated Thinking Environment. Learn how Logseq can help you become more creative using outlines and links.

item.title: A free introductory YouTube course for Logseq beginners
item.description: An eight-part YouTube series to introduce you to Logseq and help you grasp the fundamental concepts."
